common_issues.title: PiecesOS Integration and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with account linking, primarily Google and GitHub, and difficulties connecting to cloud services or running local LLMs. Solutions include staff assistance for account merging, verifying internet connection, switching to smaller local models, and ensuring correct API key configuration.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (johnkennyuk) is experiencing issues linking their personal and GitHub accounts in Pieces.
* The existing account linking flow is not working correctly and is being actively replaced.
* User has two accounts, one using their personal domain email on Google and one using their Github account.
* The goal is to merge the accounts, with the Google account as the main one.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking flow is not intuitive and causes confusion.
* There may be an issue with case sensitivity in email addresses causing the merge to fail.
* The current authentication service has limitations.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark (support staff) offered to manually merge the accounts.
* User was instructed to sign out and sign back in to trigger the account linking flow.
* Mark suggested disabling email privacy settings in GitHub to troubleshoot.
* A new authentication service is being developed that will address these issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The initial attempt to merge the accounts failed, possibly due to the case sensitivity issue.
* User is waiting for the new authentication service to be implemented.
* Mark will reengage the issue when the new service is closer to release.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new authentication service is expected to be available in early/mid March 2025.
* It is unclear whether existing account data will be migrated to the new service.

**Action Items:**

* Mark to reset the user's GitHub account and leave only the Google account.
* Mark to follow up with the user when the new authentication service is ready.

related_issues.title: Shareable link is not generating
related_issues.text:
Shareable link is not generating
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/907584e3-3310-4866-bd26-5fbf6e371d62)
Shareable link is not generating . 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Point:** User [@19richa](https://github.com/19richa) encountered an issue where they were unable to share a link.

**Problem Identified:** The user was unable to share a link within the Pieces app.

**Solution Proposed/Implemented:**
- Pieces support staff [@mark-at-pieces](https://github.com/mark-at-pieces) requested the user's email to investigate further.
- The issue appears to have resolved itself, as the user reported it was now working.

**Current Status/Outcome:** The issue is resolved. 

**Additional Notes:**
- The user was directed to relevant resources for further support. 
- No further information is available about the cause of the issue.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Difficulty making requests to cloud services.
    * Problems with local models.
* Mark-at-pieces requested logs for diagnosis.
* Rohanrathi99 provided logs and scheduled a call.
* During the call, the issues were identified and resolved:
    * Cloud LLM issue: Using a personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key).
    * Local LLM issue: Likely due to hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller model).

**Current Status:**

* Issues resolved.
* Rohanrathi99's PiecesOS is functioning as expected.

**Outcome:**

* Rohanrathi99's problem was diagnosed and fixed through collaboration with Pieces support.
* Additional insights gained into potential causes of cloud and local LLM issues.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users reported conflicts between Pieces OS and Ollama installations, leading to Cuda errors, installation failures, and connectivity problems. Solutions involved reinstalling Ollama, managing PATH variables, and addressing race conditions. Pieces OS updates aimed to resolve these issues, but some users still required individual support and troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Problem:** User johnkennyuk experienced issues with Ollama, specifically related to Cuda errors and conflicting installations between Pieces OS and the Ollama app.

**Key Points:**

* Ollama installation via Pieces OS and Winget caused conflicts.
* Existing Ollama instances were not detected by Pieces OS.
* Startup order of Ollama and Pieces OS created problems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstalling Ollama via PowerShell and reinstalling with standalone installer.
* Checking and cleaning up PATH environment variables.
* Investigating race conditions during startup.
* Implementation of fixes in Pieces OS version 11.1.2 to address race conditions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue was temporarily resolved after multiple reinstalls and cleanups, but later reoccurred.
* Fixes implemented in version 11.1.2 may not have fully addressed the problem. 
* Further investigation and troubleshooting are needed.

**Additional Notes:**

* User reported potential connection between login speed and issue occurrence.
* User requested features to detect and handle external Ollama installations. 
* Developer acknowledged the problem and offered further assistance.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Ollama installation failure on Pieces

**Key Points:**

* User waseem852 reported an issue with Ollama failing to install on Pieces, despite trying multiple installations methods including through Pieces setup, Pieces itself, and winget.
* User confirmed restarting Pieces apps and even killing them through Task Manager, but the issue persisted.

**Solutions Discussed:**

* brian-at-pieces, a support member at Pieces, suggested jumping on a call to further debug the issue.
* waseem852 agreed to the call.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A meeting was scheduled between brian-at-pieces and waseem852 to troubleshoot the issue further.
* The outcome of the meeting was not documented in the conversation.

**Additional Notes:**

* Based on the conversation, the root cause of the installation failure was not identified.
* The user was offered support to resolve the issue.
* The conversation was closed without a final resolution being documented.

**Outcome:**

* Additional insights gained into potential causes of cloud and local LLM issues.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or experiencing functionality issues, often after updates. Problems include non-dismissable overlay messages, cloud service connection errors, and local LLM issues. Solutions involve checking log files, verifying internet connection, adjusting startup settings, and collaborating with Pieces support for diagnosis and troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** MR-AAYU  reported an issue where the Pieces application was unable to launch.

**Key Points:**

* User provided logs from the "C:\Users\AYUSH-ANAND\Documents\com.pieces.pfd\production" path.
* nathan-courtney-pieces suggested checking for the "come.pieces.os" folder in OneDrive directory and potentially scheduling a meeting to diagnose the issue further. 
* Information about the user's machine (Windows version, build number, CPU, RAM) was requested.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User provided logs from the suggested path.
* Checking for the "come.pieces.os" folder in OneDrive directory.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has not been resolved yet. Further investigation is needed, potentially through a scheduled meeting.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was impatient and requested a fix urgently.
* nathan-courtney-pieces remained professional and provided helpful troubleshooting steps.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Conversation Summary: Pieces Desktop App Crashing on Windows 10

**Key Points:**

* User @ThemePark reports Pieces Desktop app crashing on Windows 10.
* The app launches on startup and seems to conflict with PiecesOS updates.
* Initially, the user thought it was just the Pieces Desktop app crashing, but later found that it crashes after launching VS Code.
* A non-dismissable overlay message appears stating that Pieces OS is not running.
* Restarting the computer is the only known way to remove the overlay message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Conflicting startup of Pieces Desktop and PiecesOS causing crashes.
* Non-dismissable overlay message after VS Code launch.
* Frequent crashes impacting user productivity.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Investigate the timing conflict:** Pieces support suspects a timing conflict between Pieces Desktop and PiecesOS startup.
* **Change startup app:** Mack suggests changing the startup app to either Pieces Desktop or PiecesOS.
* **Restarting the computer:** Currently, the only known workaround is to restart the computer.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is ongoing and impacting the user's daily workflow.
* Further investigation and solutions are needed to resolve the crashes and non-dismissable message.

**Additional Notes:**

* User provided additional information about the issue, including screenshots.
* The issue seems to be specific to the Pieces for VS Code extension.

**Next Steps:**

* Pieces support needs to investigate the reported behavior and provide an official solution.
* User can continue to provide updates and additional information to aid in troubleshooting.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers failing to launch or connect to cloud services. Issues often involve network configuration, local LLM setup, or Pieces OS dependencies. Solutions include verifying network settings, checking local LLM compatibility, and ensuring Pieces OS is properly installed and configured.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

*Mariusz-kowalski reported experiencing an error while using the Pieces Desktop App.*

**Problems identified:**

*The specific issue wasn't clearly identified in the conversation.* 
*It seemed related to previous reports on similar problems with the app on specific Linux machines.*

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

*Mack-at-pieces requested the user to share the latest Desktop App log file.*
*Mack-at-pieces offered a video call for further troubleshooting, which the user declined.*

**Current status/outcome:**

*The user provided the log file, but the conversation ends there.* 
*It's unclear if the problem was resolved or if further action was taken.*

**Additional notes:**

*The user was directed to related issues and documentation for reference.* 
*The user's username is "mariusz-kowalski".*
*The conversation took place in February 2025.*

    * Difficulty making requests to cloud services.
    * Problems with local models.
* Mark-at-pieces requested logs for diagnosis.
* Rohanrathi99 provided logs and scheduled a call.
* During the call, the issues were identified and resolved:
    * Cloud LLM issue: Using a personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key).
    * Local LLM issue: Likely due to hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller model).

**Current Status:**

* Issues resolved.
* Rohanrathi99's PiecesOS is functioning as expected.

**Outcome:**

* Rohanrathi99's problem was diagnosed and fixed through collaboration with Pieces support.
* Additional insights gained into potential causes of cloud and local LLM issues.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Crashes and Errors
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS crashing or encountering errors, particularly on Windows. Issues include conflicts with the Pieces Desktop app, problems with cloud services and local LLMs, and non-dismissable overlay messages. Suggested solutions involve checking internet connection, switching networks, using smaller LLM models, and adjusting startup settings. Restarting the computer often provides a temporary fix.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application

Windows

11.1.2

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I enable Long term memory engine on and use it on pieces for dev or vscode when I try to prompt anything, piecesOS shit's off and starts looping on restart until I manage in the seconds it stays on to disable the LTM engine.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @rafael-a-g-n created an issue regarding high CPU usage on Pieces OS in Linux Mint 22.1.
* The issue has been automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate Pieces team member.
* Similar issues have been reported previously (#626, #606, #590).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User is advised to refer to existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel for further information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation is dated February 27, 2025. It is important to note that this is before your cutoff date of November 2023.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Difficulty making requests to cloud services.
    * Problems with local models.
* Mark-at-pieces requested logs for diagnosis.
* Rohanrathi99 provided logs and scheduled a call.
* During the call, the issues were identified and resolved:
    * Cloud LLM issue: Using a personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key).
    * Local LLM issue: Likely due to hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller model).

**Current Status:**

* Issues resolved.
* Rohanrathi99's PiecesOS is functioning as expected.

**Outcome:**

* Rohanrathi99's problem was diagnosed and fixed through collaboration with Pieces support.
* Additional insights gained into potential causes of cloud and local LLM issues.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Conversation Summary: Pieces Desktop App Crashing on Windows 10

**Key Points:**

* User @ThemePark reports Pieces Desktop app crashing on Windows 10.
* The app launches on startup and seems to conflict with PiecesOS updates.
* Initially, the user thought it was just the Pieces Desktop app crashing, but later found that it crashes after launching VS Code.
* A non-dismissable overlay message appears stating that Pieces OS is not running.
* Restarting the computer is the only known way to remove the overlay message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Conflicting startup of Pieces Desktop and PiecesOS causing crashes.
* Non-dismissable overlay message after VS Code launch.
* Frequent crashes impacting user productivity.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Investigate the timing conflict:** Pieces support suspects a timing conflict between Pieces Desktop and PiecesOS startup.
* **Change startup app:** Mack suggests changing the startup app to either Pieces Desktop or PiecesOS.
* **Restarting the computer:** Currently, the only known workaround is to restart the computer.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is ongoing and impacting the user's daily workflow.
* Further investigation and solutions are needed to resolve the crashes and non-dismissable message.

**Additional Notes:**

* User provided additional information about the issue, including screenshots.
* The issue seems to be specific to the Pieces for VS Code extension.

**Next Steps:**

* Pieces support needs to investigate the reported behavior and provide an official solution.
* User can continue to provide updates and additional information to aid in troubleshooting.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS and Ollama integration issues:** This is a recurring problem affecting multiple users and hindering core functionality. Focus on identifying the root causes of conflicts, Cuda errors, and installation failures.  Improve error messages and troubleshooting documentation for these issues.

**Investigate and address PiecesOS launch and functionality problems:** Issues like non-dismissable overlays, cloud service connection errors, and local LLM problems are causing significant user frustration. Improve logging and diagnostics to help identify the causes of these issues and provide more effective solutions.

**Improve account linking and cloud service connectivity:** Users are experiencing difficulties with account linking, particularly with Google and GitHub, and connecting to cloud services. Review and streamline the account linking process. Provide clearer instructions and troubleshooting steps for users experiencing connectivity issues.

**Enhance communication and documentation:** Provide timely updates on known issues and their solutions. Create comprehensive troubleshooting guides for common problems, including step-by-step instructions and clear explanations. Consider creating video tutorials for complex issues.

**Gather more detailed user feedback:** Encourage users to provide detailed information about their system configuration, steps to reproduce the issue, and any error messages encountered. This will help in identifying patterns and resolving issues more effectively.

**Proactively monitor system performance and stability:** Implement monitoring tools to detect potential issues before they escalate. This will allow for quicker response times and minimize user impact.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for Pieces for Developers:** Given the specific issues reported with this tool, a dedicated support channel could provide more targeted assistance and faster resolution times.

**Prioritize issues based on frequency and impact:** Use data on ticket volume and activity level to prioritize the most critical issues affecting the user base. This will ensure that resources are allocated effectively to address the most impactful problems first.
